intro: Pedicularis balkharica, commonly known as the Balkh carnation, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 450 species of flowering plants, many of which are known for their unique and often striking floral structures. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The botanical features of Pedicularis balkharica make it a subject of interest for both botanists and horticulturists.
